thomsonpy.thomson_scattering.ne_models module

This module contains the electron density functions which admit readable models by this software.

thomsonpy.thomson_scattering.ne_models.crammer_model(d)

This model retrieves the electron number density profile obtained by Crammer et al. (1999) using the UVCS/WLC aboard SOHO satellite. Initially, the units are . Therefore a units conversion factor have been applied to convert from to .

Parameters

d (float) – distance QS.

Warning

Be careful with the units of parameter d. Its must be in . Otherwise, the model will not work properly.

Returns

electron number density profile at the given distance .

Return type

float

thomsonpy.thomson_scattering.ne_models.predictive_science_model(z, TG, NE_MODEL)

This model retrieves the electron number density from a simulation made and published by Predictive Science Inc. for the solar eclipse of 4th December, 2021 for a given distance from the point of view of the observer () to the scattering point () with a predefined ThomsonGeometry object that manages the coherence of the rest of the geometric components for the ray-tracing process.

Warning

This model will not work without a model (NE_MODEL) structured in the Octree data structure managed in the thomsonpy package.

Parameters

  • z (float) – distance OQ.

  • TG (thomsonpy.thomson_scattering.thomson_scattering_tools.ThomsonGeometry) – an object managing the internal coherence of the geometric components of the Thomson scattering ray-tracing process.

  • NE_MODEL (thomsonpy.data_management.octree.octree.Octree) – an Octree containing a cloud of Data` objects representing the cloud of points with physical measures provided by Predictive Science Inc.

Returns

electron number density for the solar eclipse of 4th December, 2021.

Return type

float

thomsonpy.thomson_scattering.thomson_scattering_tools module

This module contains the main tools needed for computing Thomson scattering in the solar corona.

Numerical integration of the Thomson scattering along the line of sight over z.

  • epsilon (float) – elongation angle , Q-O-S.

  • ini_z (float) – starting value for the independent variable representing the distance OQ.

  • fin_z (float) – final value for the independent variable representing the distance OQ.

  • incr_z (float) – step value in the numerical integration for the independent variable representing the distance OQ.

  • u (float) – coefficient of limb-darkening.

  • TG (float) – object ThomsonGeometry storing information about the geometry applied to this function when working with models of electron density and ray - tracing computations.

  • NE_MODEL (float) – model of electron density needed for some simulations, not set by default.

integrated Thomson scattering factor por a given geometry over z.

class thomsonpy.thomson_scattering.thomson_scattering_tools.ThomsonGeometry(sun_center, observer, target, radius)

Bases: object

This class manages the Thomson scattering geometry and also offers many methods useful for frequent calculations related with the Thomson scattering geometry. Additionally, its internal structure has been designed to support a ray-tracing process in the direction between the observer point of view () and the scattering point ().

static faux_chi(x, z, epsilon)

It gets a value for the scattering angle, S-Q-O (rad) as a function of the distance OS (x), the distance OQ (z) and the elongation angle (), S-Q-O.

Distance QS (d) is needed for the computations, and therefore obtained from the function thomsonpy.thomson_scattering.thomson_scattering_tools.ThomsonGeometry.faux_d(x, z, epsilon)

Parameters

  • x (float) – distance OS.

  • z (float) – distance OQ.

  • epsilon (float) – elongation angle, Q-O-S (rad).

Returns

scattering angle, S-Q-O (rad).

Return type

float

thomsonpy.thomson_scattering.thomson_scattering_tools.coef_limb_darkening(wavelength, units=10000000000.0)

Adaptation from the private function __allen_clv to obtain the coefficient of limb-darkening needed for the Thomson scattering computations.

The __allen_clv is a function based at the Allen tables (Astrophysical Quantities, Springer 2000) an implemented in the SPG (IAA - CSIC) repositories.

Parameters

  • wavelength (float) – wavelength in I.S. units (meters).

  • units (float) – unit conversion factor, by default , the one used to convert from meters to Ángstroms. Ángstroms are the unit used in __allev_clv function. If the parameter wavelength is not in I.S. units, a new value should be given.

Returns

coefficient of limb-darkening .

Return type

float

thomsonpy.thomson_scattering.thomson_scattering_tools.f_Irec_z(x, epsilon, z, u, TG=None, NE_MODEL=None)

It computes the factor of intensity received after the Thomson scattering phenomenon at a point of line of sight.

Parameters

  • x (float) – distance OS.

  • epsilon (float) – elongation angle , Q-O-S.

  • z (float) – distance OQ (independent variable of the function).

  • u (float) – coefficient of limb-darkening.

  • TG (float) – object ThomsonGeometry storing information about the geometry applied to this function when working with models of electron density and ray - tracing computations.

  • NE_MODEL (float) – model of electron density needed for some simulations, not set by default.

Returns

factor of intensity received from the Thomson scattering phenomenon at the given point.

Return type

float

Computation of the scattered light by the Thomson Scattering of the K-Corona.

  • temperature – temperature of the Sun.

  • x (float) – distance OS.

  • epsilon (float) – elongation angle , Q-O-S.

  • ini_z (float) – starting value for the independent variable representing the distance OQ.

  • fin_z (float) – final value for the independent variable representing the distance OQ.

  • incr_z (float) – step value in the numerical integration for the independent variable representing the distance OQ.

  • u (float) – coefficient of limb-darkening.

  • TG (float) – object ThomsonGeometry storing information about the geometry applied to this function when working with models of electron density and ray - tracing computations.

  • NE_MODEL (float) – model of electron density needed for some simulations, not set by default.

Returns

scattered light for a given wavelength, temperature and line of sight ( in I.S. units).
